Text: I bought this book 20 yrs back. Since its still in good condition, I thought I should share it. Such thick paperbacks are usually not scannable but this was an exception. It took me almost a week to scan & edit 580 pages and then to finalize the PDF. I have not added bookmarks to this.

Great share. A fine scan. Thanks for bending your back and the book's.
I think i'll read 'Witness for Prosecution' first. Its been a long time.
Back-breaking!? Yeah, that's what I have always maintained : Scanning a printed book to PDF
Back-breaking!? Yeah, that's what I have always maintained : Scanning a printed book to PDF is much more labour-intensive than ripping a CD/DVD but is also less rewarding!

Maybe the universe is gently pushing you to design a home-made scanner using a vacuum cleaner, some electronics etc. :)
Or just buy the SR300 !

gnv65, maybe scanning is less rewarding, but rest assured your leechers do highly appreciate your efforts! so, thanks bunches, man (or ma'am).

:-)
